citation.article-title: Desulfurella acetivorans gen. nov. and sp. nov. - a new thermophilic sulfur-reducing eubacterium.

p.s: Desulfurella (De.sulfu.rel'la L.pref. de from L. n. sulfur sulfur; L. n. fem. Desulfurella - sulfur-reducing bacterium)
Cells are short rods with oval ends, motile with a single polar flagellum, does not form spores, cell wall of Gram-negative type.
On an agarized medium with polysulfide, forms white irregular colonies upto 1 mm in diameter.
Cell mass of dark grey colour.
Grows at temperatures ranging from 44 to 70°C with an optimum at 52-57°C and at pH between 4.3 and 7.5, with an optimum at 6.8 - 7.0.
Reduces elemental sulfur with acetate as the sole source of energy and carbon.
Does not ferment organic substrates, does not use electron acceptors other than sulfur.
Growth products are H2S and CO2.
Isolated from thermophilic cyanobacterial mat, containing elemental sulfur, in the Uzon caldere (Kamchatka).
The G + C content of DNA is 31.4 ± 1 mol%.
